intro: Cleidiocarpon, commonly known as the golden cup, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Cleidiocarpon is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
